title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) #> [1] "No Bib files found !" #> [1] "will need to convert bbl to .bib" #> Error in if (which(grepl("\\}$", single_bib_data)) == which(grepl("^\\s*\\\\bibitem\\[",     single_bib_data))) {    start_idx <- which(grepl("^\\s*\\\\bibitem\\[", single_bib_data))    bib_record$unique_id <- str_split(str_split(gsub("\\\\bibitem\\[|\\]",         "", single_bib_data[start_idx]), "\\{")[[1]][2], "\\}")[[1]][1]    break_points <- which(grepl("\\\\newblock", single_bib_data))    if ((break_points[1] - start_idx) == 2) {        bib_record$author <- paste("{{", gsub("\\.$", "", single_bib_data[start_idx +             1]), "}}")    }    if ((break_points[1] - start_idx) == 3) {        bib_record$author <- paste("{{", gsub("\\.$", "", single_bib_data[start_idx +             1]), gsub("\\.$", "", single_bib_data[start_idx +             2]), "}}")    }}: the condition has length > 1 cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> Warning: cannot open file '/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/rebib/article/example.bib': No such file or directory #> Error in file(con, "r"): cannot open the connection
